decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate mana by sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion and Ichor Wellspring. This allows for explosive turns where players can cycle through their deck and set up powerful combos. Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever help to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Engineered Explosives provide control against opposing threats. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a large amount of mana and card advantage to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana, allowing for the casting of powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes various tools for control and disruption, such as Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, and Field of Ruin. The goal is to control the game through powerful threats and disruption while overwhelming the opponent with mana advantage from the UrzaTron lands.

The key strategy of this deck is to aggressively use cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand while quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Thought Scour and Street Wraith. This enables the player to lower their life total and efficiently play powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. The deck also includes ways to protect these threats with cards like Stubborn Denial and Temur Battle Rage, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out a wide variety of aggressive Human creatures while utilizing powerful disruption effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and pump up the team with Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, tempo-based strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful Human synergies like Champion of the Parish and Noble Hierarch help to maximize the deck's potential for explosive starts and aggressive interactions.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can then be used to play Walking Ballista for a win condition. The deck also includes a Creatures Toolbox package with cards like Eternal Witness, Kitchen Finks, and Reflector Mage for versatility and resilience. Chord of Calling and Collected Company help find the necessary pieces for the combo while also providing additional creature threats and utility. The strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for and deploying creatures to control the board and execute the combo.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Cryptic Command, Snapcaster Mage, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Search for Azcanta to dominate the board and out-value the opponent. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile, Lightning Bolt, and Lightning Helix to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and lands. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a drawn-out game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks and Mox Opal, while also recurring artifacts such as Ichor Wellspring and Scrap Trawler to generate card advantage and maintain consistency. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces to create a loop of sacrificing artifacts for mana and card draw, eventually leading to a win condition such as The Antiquities War or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck focuses on efficient and synergistic artifact interactions to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells, card draw, and ways to tutor for key pieces like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map. The overall strategy is to control the game with powerful threats and disruption while outpacing opponents with its ramp capabilities.

The main concept of this deck is to use discard and self-mill effects to empty your hand quickly and get powerful creatures like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler onto the battlefield for little to no cost. With additional threats like Flameblade Adept and Flamewake Phoenix, this aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure and overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Utilizing cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to quickly cycle through your deck and fuel your graveyard, this Hollow One deck relies on speed and aggression to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing low-cost, aggressive Human creatures that synergize well together. It utilizes cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to grow creatures and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to interfere with the opponent's game plan. The use of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, while Cavern of Souls ensures that creatures can't be countered. The deck aims to win games through fast and efficient creature beats.

The deck utilizes Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate mana by sacrificing artifacts, allowing for explosive turns and enabling combos with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to recur artifacts from the graveyard. Inventors' Fair provides additional card advantage and life gain, while cards like Ancient Stirrings help to find key combo pieces. Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb provide removal options, while Mox Opal and Mind Stone accelerate mana production. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of artifacts and mana.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Stone to deal with threats and disrupt opponents. The deck also includes ramp cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to help find the key lands. The win conditions include powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, as well as removal and disruption spells to control the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. With this mana, the deck aims to control the game through powerful colorless spells and threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and various large creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect itself, like Nature's Claim, Relic of Progenitus, and Leyline of Sanctity.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently assemble UrzaTron (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and play powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck includes various tutors like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map, along with card advantage engines like Ancient Stirrings and Chromatic Star to ensure consistent gameplay. It also includes removal spells like Dismember and Oblivion Stone for control and survivability. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Modern Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck aims to control the game with removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista while efficiently finding the Tron lands with cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings. The deck also includes ways to tutor for key pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Expedition Map and Ghost Quarter.
